title: 1923–24 Lancashire Cup
text:
The 1923–24 Lancashire Cup competition was the sixteenth competition for this regional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> tournament. The trophy was won by <a href="St%20Helens%20Recreation%20RLFC">St Helens Recs</a> who beat <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the final at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a>, by a score of 17-0. The attendance was a new record for the competition final at the time, being 25,656 and receipts £1,450. The triumph by St Helens Recs was the first time the club had won the competition and also the first time that winning club were not one of the original clubs who formed the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League">Northern Union</a>.
Background.
The number of teams entering this year’s competition remained at 13, with again no junior/amateur team being admitted. This resulted in 3 byes in the first round.
The quarter-final match between <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> and <a href="Widnes%20Vikings">Widnes</a> took three matches to finally decide, the second replay being held at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>.
Competition and Results.
Round 1.
Involved 5 matches (with three byes) and 13 clubs
Final.
Teams and scorers.
Scoring - Try = three (3) points - Goal = two (2) points - Drop goal = two (2) points
